page.title: 07THE SAND PIT
page.content: There is a large sand and gravel pit in Barling. It was first started 26 years ago.Each day 500 tonnes are dug out and sold.The pit produces pit sand, sharp sand and soft washed sand as well as stones of different sizes. As the present workings are some way from where the sand is sorted it is loaded onto a conveyor belt which is 500 metres long. There is a safety wire near the belt which stops if anyone touches it. Before the sand is dug out the topsoil is removed and kept in a pile. Then all the sand is taken. Rubbish lorries fill up the hole. The refuse is sealed with clay and the topsoil is put back. The land can then be farmed again. Two of the older parts of the pit have not been filled in and they are now full of water.They are used for fishing and many birds have their homes there.
